alert.note: Alert for Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Raleigh, northeastern Wyoming and southeastern Fayette Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sophia, or 9 miles west of Beckley, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Mabscott, Sophia, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Coal City, Bradley, Shady Spring, Prosperity, Beaver, Daniels, Piney View, Stanaford, Meadow Bridge, Lester, Rhodell, Bolt, Arnett, and Ghent. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 51. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southern and southeastern West Virginia.
